bangalore.description:
No of People Coming: Unknown At an impressionable age of three, Sachind used his imagination to draw fish and thus began his artistic journey. At the age of nine he drew a cockerel for a school assignment and he was reprimanded by his teacher because she was sure he had traced it. Being a lover of animals he used water colors to bring out the beauty of their creation.

Vehicle body styling and product designing fascinated his teen years. Unaided by any formal training, Sachind worked alone at his skill. His perfectionist nature, with an eye for detail, keeps him working on every dot and line of his artwork. His inherent interest in art and design caused him to also pursue graphic design and civil architecture. He designed the home of his parents, friends and also the home he now resides in.

bangalore.name: Urbanization and the Fate of Small Farmers by Prof.Amit Bhaduri
bangalore.locationName: Ginserv Auditorium Global Incubation Services, CA Site No:1, Behind Hotel, Leela Palace Kempinski, HAL 3rd Stage, Kodihalli, Karntaka bangalore
bangalore.description: No of People Coming: Unknown  About the Talk Development has become synonymous with urbanization. Urbanization is widespread in India with nearly 42 % of its people to live in cities by 2030. While urban demand for food is supposed to get good prices for farm produce, cities also take land and water away from agriculture. All these affect the lives of small holders across the country who form 85% of our farming community. The talk will explore this phenomenon and explain the link between the political issue of agrarian distress on the one hand, and the problem of increasing degradation of urban environment on the other. About the Speaker  Amit Bhaduri has served as Professor of Political Economy at the University of Pavia, Italy, Reader at the Delhi School of Economics, and Professor at the Indian Institute of Management, Calcutta. bangalore.name: Trust Machine aka Bitcoin / Blockchain / Crypto, Changing the Future of FinTech
bangalore.locationName: https://appear.in/bitcointech Online Hangout Webinar!!!bangalore
bangalore.description:
No of People Coming: 47 A block chain or blockchain is a permission less distributed database based on the bitcoin protocol that maintains a continuously growing list of transactional data records hardened against tampering and revision, even by operators of the data store's nodes. The initial and most widely known application of the block chain technology is the public ledger of transactions for bitcoin which has been the inspiration for similar implementations often known as alt chains.

Bitcoin - the decentralised digital cryptocurrency powered by a vast computer network has a stable value around $250 for most of the year. Among regulators and financial institutions, scepticism has given way to enthusiasm (the European Union recently recognised it as a currency). The extraordinary potential of the blockchain, the technology significantly stretches far and beyond into crypto fintech innovation. The blockchain lets people who have no particular confidence in each other collaborate without having to go throug

bangalore.locationName: #259,2nd Main, 6th Cross Rd, Indiranagar 1st Stage, Karnataka 560041 YourStory Media Pvt Ltdbangalore
bangalore.description:
No of People Coming: 105 Topic: IAM top 10 best practices

With running of your operations on AWS comes the responsibility of ensuring the security and access control among other things. More often than not, users have too much permission than what is required to do their job. This talk takes you through the top 10 best practices for Identity and Access Management (IAM) that help you to stay secure.

Topic: IAM Federation

Once your AWS footprint grows and if you are tasked with managing multiple AWS accounts and lots of different users on each of those accounts, access control will become a challenge in itself. This talk explores the options available for federating access to AWS using your own user database. We will also cover in some depth the SAML based federation to AWS. We will use FreeIPA as a user database and demo couple of scenarios.

Speaker : Prashant Bapat, APIGEE

Topic: Become an IAM Policy Ninja

 What are Managed Policies, Inline Policies, Resource Based Policies ?

 How to test IAM Policies w

bangalore.name: Email Marketing and Lead Generation!
bangalore.locationName: #45, DTDC Courier Office, Millers' Road, Vasanth Nagar Social Cutlet Officebangalore
bangalore.description:
No of People Coming: 21 Most Indian businesses understand email marketing as buying a database of people and spamming them about their offers or profile.

If you are doing it and don't see it working, here's why:

1. Spamming is Unethical and Unpleasant.2. Databases/email lists can be purchased but there's no guarantee they would be accurate.3. Gmail, yahoo and other email service subscribers are strict about anti-spam and more and more unsolicited mails are getting bounced. So most of them don't even reach Inbox!4. The open rate is merely 1%! That's negligible and you don't even know if it's the right audience!

Does it mean email marketing is dead?

Far from that!

We'll talk about how to generate your target audience emails and how to convert them into paying customers!

With these practices, the email open rates can be as high as 75%*.

Let's discuss the more in the Meetup. Like I always say, come with questions!

Whether your are B2B or B2C, real estate or E-commerce, it's for you! 

Best,Aayush.

bangalore.name: Discuss books on Mythology
bangalore.locationName: #82, 7th Main, 4th B Block near BDA complex, Koramangala Muffets And Tuffets, bangalore
bangalore.description:
No of People Coming: 13 As literature, the mythology offers complex, engaging, and often amusing entertainment. Even the brutal stories of Oedipus ,Orestes or Karna became famous standalone works of literature engaging readers for decades. The scientific aspect of the myths is most visible in those that attempt to explain certain phenomena Procne and Philomela (why the swallow has no song), and Hercules at Gibraltar (how the Rock of Gibraltar appeared) are classic examples.

The mythology also tries to answer a question that straddles the line between religion and morality. In this world, morality is cast in religious terms. Most of the best known mythslike those of The Mahabharata, Baldur, the Trojan War, deal with the cruelty and pain that even the greatest heroes face. Such stories make sense of the worlds senseless cruelty, demonstrating that, for whatever reason, the gods necessarily maintain a place for suffering in the world.

In addition to to discussing the works of literature based on the mythologie

bangalore.description:
No of People Coming: 28 Becoming agile is one thing, but becoming competitive is another. Today, many organizations are already working on agile transformations. The next step is to provide value every day, on multiple moments of the day, as one continuous flow. This continuous flow of value is what is known as continuous delivery. Continuous Delivery has many aspects that an organization needs to get in place. It requires your organization to be agile. From that point on you can automate the different steps in the delivery process even further. The delivery process needs to be supported with a variety of tools.

Growth hacker has become a hot job title, because marketers need to increasingly become more technical (and vice versa). bangalore.description:
No of People Coming: 17 Topic - "Significance Testing For Quantitative Trading Strategies" , Adithya

Abstract : The talk will be about Algorithmic Trading which has been around forever with several automated systems floating around the trading world. In this meetup, we address one of the most common questions when it comes to trading algorithm development : How does one separate the grain from the chaff?

We show how basic statistics and statistical tests can be combined with hypotheses in the market in order to test the robustness of a system. We take a basic case study of a famous trading system : Best Day of the Week , and apply our methods to assess its robustness.

Speaker bio - Adithya has been developing trading algorithms for Indian markets. He is passionate about quantitative finance, algo trading and applied mathematics in general. bangalore.description:
No of People Coming: 18 To Register for Webinar: http://www.visiontemenos.com/events/webinar/the-temenos-iceberg-model-for-culture-change

Ever wonder what cultural change looks like within an Enterprise? Well, it looks like an iceberg! Some parts of the culture are visible, some parts are partially visible, and some parts are completely hidden from view. As an Enterprise Change Agent, its important to understand this to be effective, whether youre internal to the Enterprise (iCAT), external to the Enterprise (eCAT), or an executive Change Agent (xCAT).

In this webinar - the third in the Temenos webinar series - we will present the Temenos Iceberg Model, where youll gain valuable insight into how you can navigate the tricky waters of Cultural Change.

To Register for Webinar: http://www.visiontemenos.com/events/webinar/the-temenos-iceberg-model-for-culture-change

delhi.name: Building Big Data applications with Apache Beam and Apache Apex (native Hadoop)
delhi.description:
No of People Coming: 14 The event will cover - Building streaming applications with Apache Beam and Apache Apex.

Apache Apex is a native Hadoop data in motion platform that is being used by customers for both streaming as well as batch processing. Common use cases include ingestion into Hadoop, streaming analytics, ETL, database off-loads, alerts and monitoring, machine model scoring, etc.

Agenda:

6:45am - Kenn Knowles, Software Engineer, Google & Apache Beam (incubating) PPMC member

7:30am - Q&A

7:45am - Siyuan Hua, Apache Apex Committer & DataTorrent Engineer

Abstract:

Talk 1: Apache Beam (incubating) is a programming model and library for unified batch & streaming big data processing. This talk will cover the Beam programming model broadly, including its origin story and vision for the future. We will dig into how Beam separates concerns for authors of streaming data processing pipelines, isolating what you want to compute from where your data is distributed in time and when you want
